DOC.brief_summary: This study evaluated the efficacy and safety of amlodipine/benazepril compared with that of enalapril in the treatment of hypertension in African-American patients with type 2 diabetes.
DOC.brief_title: Effects of Amlodipine/Benazepril in the Hypertensive African-American Population With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
DOC.criteria: AfricanAmerican males and females current diagnosis of type 2 diabetes documented by medical history; mean sitting diastolic blood pressure of ≥ 90 and ≤ 110 mm Hg; HbA1C ≤ 9.5% having unilateral or bilateral renal artery stenosis; having clinically significant cardiac dysrhythmias; having a significant history of coronary artery disease within the past 6 months; having a history or diagnosis of congestive heart failure (CHF); having any clinically relevant cardiac valvular disease
